metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2915 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Xen 4.4.x, when running on ARM systems, does not properly restrict access to hardware features, which allows local guest users to cause a denial of service (host or guest crash) via unspecified vectors, related to (1) cache control, (2) coprocessors, (3) debug registers, and (4) other unspecified registers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-utils-common - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xenstore-utils - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Only affects ARM 32 bit, ARM 64 bit, 4.4 and newer. Only "medium" because advisory indicates privilege escalation is not thought possible

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1').
